Osejs.Information.Title: Falling rods
Osejs.Information.Abstract: Two rods are dropped over a smooth table. In one case the end point on the table can slide without friction, while in the other case it may rotate around a horizontal smooth articulation. The simulation allows computing fall times and trajectories.
Osejs.Information.Author: Juan M. Aguirregabiria (http://tp.lc.ehu.es/jma.html)

Variable.Name: stopEvents
Variable.Comment: Stop when a rod reaches horizontal

Variable.Name: showTraj
Variable.Comment: Show trajectories of end point and center-of-mass

PreliminaryCode.Comment: Code to be executed before rate equations are evaluated

Content.Comment: Have to use second-order equations, because first-order do not always move from initial point (allowed by conservation law)

Osejs.View.Creation.Element.Property: Initial height of the free end
Show trajectories of center-of-mass and free end
Pause when a rod reaches the horizontal
